column4: OK, this is my idiotic question for the day: Is there a way to get the grub bootloader to open the CD-ROM drive?
Or, I guess, some way to open a CD-ROM drive on a non-bootable computer where there's no button on the front to open it?
....Well, the problem is the drive is empty.
If I can get a liveCD in there, I can fix the GRUB bootloader.
....Welll, that seems ludicrously complex enough to try.

you can take the broad connector on your motherboard and remove it and stick something that leads electricity between 2 pins to make the psu start so your cd-drive gets juice thus letting you remove the cd without actually starting ... most of the computer ;)
